cache_inode_rdwr.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00092 #include "fsal.h"
00093 
00094 #include "LRU_List.h"
00095 #include "log_functions.h"
00096 #include "HashData.h"
00097 #include "HashTable.h"
00098 #include "cache_inode.h"
00099 #include "cache_content.h"
00100 #include "stuff_alloc.h"
00101 
00102 #include <unistd.h>
00103 #include <sys/types.h>
00104 #include <sys/stat.h>
00105 #include <sys/param.h>
00106 #include <time.h>
00107 #include <pthread.h>
00108 
00133 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_rdwr( cache_entry_t              * pentry, 
00134                                        cache_inode_io_direction_t   read_or_write,
00135                                        fsal_seek_t                * seek_descriptor,
00136                                        fsal_size_t                  buffer_size,  
00137                                        fsal_size_t                * pio_size,
00138                                        fsal_attrib_list_t         * pfsal_attr,
00139                                        caddr_t                      buffer,    
00140                                        fsal_boolean_t             * p_fsal_eof,
00141                                        hash_table_t               * ht,  
00142                                        cache_inode_client_t       * pclient, 
00143                                        fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00144                                        cache_inode_status_t       * pstatus )
00145 {
00146   int                          statindex = 0 ;
00147   cache_content_io_direction_t io_direction ;
00148   cache_content_status_t       cache_content_status ;
00149   fsal_status_t                fsal_status ;
00150   fsal_openflags_t             openflags ;
00151   fsal_size_t                  io_size ;
00152   fsal_attrib_list_t           post_write_attr; 
00153   fsal_status_t                fsal_status_getattr ;
00154   struct stat                  buffstat ;
00155  
00156   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00157   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00158 
00159   /* For now, only FSAL_SEEK_SET is supported */
00160   if( seek_descriptor->whence != FSAL_SEEK_SET )
00161     {
00162       DisplayLogJd( pclient->log_outputs, 
00163                     "Implementation trouble: seek_descriptor was not a 'FSAL_SEEK_SET' cursor" ) ;
00164       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00165       return *pstatus ;
00166     }
00167   
00168                     
00169   io_size = buffer_size ;
00170 
00171 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
00172   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00173                      "---> INODE : IO Size = %llu fdsize =%d seeksize=%d",
00174                      buffer_size , sizeof( fsal_file_t ), sizeof( fsal_seek_t ) ) ;
00175 #endif
00176 
00177   /* stat */
00178   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00179   if( read_or_write == CACHE_INODE_READ )
00180     {
00181       statindex    = CACHE_INODE_READ_DATA;
00182       io_direction = CACHE_CONTENT_READ ;
00183       openflags    = FSAL_O_RDONLY ;
00184       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_READ_DATA] += 1 ;
00185     }
00186   else
00187     {
00188       statindex    = CACHE_INODE_WRITE_DATA ;
00189       io_direction = CACHE_CONTENT_WRITE ;
00190       openflags    = FSAL_O_WRONLY ;
00191       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_WRITE_DATA] += 1 ;
00192     }
00193 
00194    P( pentry->lock ) ;
00195   
00196    /* IO are done only on REGULAR_FILEs */
00197    if( pentry->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE )
00198     {
00199       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00200       V( pentry->lock ) ;
00201 
00202       /* stats */
00203       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00204       
00205       return *pstatus ;
00206     }
00207 
00208    /* Non absolute address within the file are not supported (we act only like pread/pwrite) */
00209    if( seek_descriptor->whence != FSAL_SEEK_SET )
00210      {
00211        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00212        V( pentry->lock ) ;
00213        
00214       /* stats */
00215        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00216        
00217        return *pstatus ;
00218      }
00219 
00220     /* Calls file content cache to operate on the cache */
00221    if( pentry->object.file.pentry_content != NULL )
00222      {
00223        /* Entry is data cached */
00224        cache_content_rdwr( pentry->object.file.pentry_content, 
00225                            io_direction,
00226                            seek_descriptor, 
00227                            &io_size,
00228                            pio_size,
00229                            buffer, 
00230                            p_fsal_eof,
00231                            &buffstat,
00232                            (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client, 
00233                            pcontext, 
00234                            &cache_content_status ) ;
00235 
00236        /* If the entry under resync */
00237        if( cache_content_status == CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_NOT_FOUND )
00238          {
00239            /* Data cache gc has removed this entry */
00240           if(  cache_content_new_entry( pentry,
00241                                         NULL,
00242                                         (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client,
00243                                          RENEW_ENTRY,
00244                                          pcontext,
00245                                          &cache_content_status ) == NULL )
00246             { 
00247                /* Entry could not be recoverd, cache_content_status contains an error, let it be managed by the next block */
00248                DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00249                                  "Read/Write Operation through cache failed with status %d (renew process failed)",     
00250                                   cache_content_status ) ;
00251 
00252             } 
00253            else
00254             {
00255                 /* Entry was successfully renewed */
00256                 DisplayLog( "----> File Content Entry %p was successfully renewed", pentry ) ;
00257 
00258                 /* Try to access the content of the file again */
00259                 cache_content_rdwr( pentry->object.file.pentry_content,
00260                                     io_direction,
00261                                     seek_descriptor,
00262                                     &io_size,
00263                                     pio_size,
00264                                     buffer,
00265                                     p_fsal_eof,
00266                                     &buffstat,
00267                                     (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client,
00268                                     pcontext,
00269                                     &cache_content_status ) ;
00270 
00271                 /* No management of cache_content_status in case of failure, this will be done 
00272                  * within the next block */
00273             }
00274                 
00275          }
00276 
00277 
00278        if( cache_content_status != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ) 
00279          {
00280            *pstatus = cache_content_error_convert( cache_content_status ) ;
00281 
00282            V( pentry->lock ) ;
00283               
00284            DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00285                               "Read/Write Operation through cache failed with status %d",cache_content_status ) ;
00286          
00287            
00288            /* stats */
00289            pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00290            
00291            return *pstatus ;
00292          }
00293 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE    
00294        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG,
00295                           "inode/dc: io_size=%llu, pio_size=%llu,  eof=%d, seek=%d.%llu", 
00296                           io_size, *pio_size, *p_fsal_eof, seek_descriptor->whence, seek_descriptor->offset ) ;
00297   
00298        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG,
00299                           "---> INODE  AFTER : IO Size = %llu %llu", io_size, *pio_size ) ;
00300 #endif
00301      
00302         /* Use information from the buffstat to update the file metadata */
00303         pentry->object.file.attributes.filesize = buffstat.st_size ;
00304         pentry->object.file.attributes.spaceused = buffstat.st_blksize * buffstat.st_blocks ;  
00305 
00306      }
00307    else
00308      {
00309        /* No data cache entry, we operated directly on FSAL */
00310        pentry->object.file.attributes.asked_attributes =  pclient->attrmask ;
00311 
00312    
00313        /* Open the file if needed */
00314        if( pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno < 0 ) 
00315          {
00316            if( cache_inode_open( pentry, 
00317                                 pclient, 
00318                                 openflags,
00319                                 pcontext,
00320                                 pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
00321             {
00322               V( pentry->lock ) ;
00323            
00324               /* stats */
00325               pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00326            
00327               return *pstatus ;
00328             } 
00329          }
00330        
00331        /* Call FSAL_read or FSAL_write */
00332 
00333        switch( read_or_write )
00334          {
00335          case CACHE_INODE_READ:
00336            fsal_status = FSAL_read( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), 
00337                                     seek_descriptor, 
00338                                     io_size, 
00339                                     buffer, 
00340                                     pio_size, 
00341                                     p_fsal_eof ) ;
00342            break ;
00343            
00344          case CACHE_INODE_WRITE:
00345            fsal_status = FSAL_write( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), 
00346                                      seek_descriptor, 
00347                                      io_size, 
00348                                      buffer, 
00349                                      pio_size ) ;
00350  
00351            break ;
00352          }
00353        
00354        if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00355          {
00356            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00357 
00358            if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_DELAY )
00359              printf( "--------------------------> EBUSY \n" ) ;
00360            else
00361              printf( "----> rdwr: fsal_status.major =%d\n", fsal_status.major ) ;
00362            
00363           FSAL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ;
00364           pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op = 0 ;
00365           pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno = -1 ;
00366            
00367           V( pentry->lock ) ;
00368           
00369           /* stats */
00370           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00371           
00372           return *pstatus ;
00373         } 
00374 
00375         if( read_or_write == CACHE_INODE_WRITE ) 
00376           {
00377              /* Do a getattr in order to have update information on filesize 
00378               * This query is done directly on FSAL (object is not data cached), and result
00379               * will be propagated to Cache Inode */
00380               
00381              /* WARNING: This operation is to be done AFTER FSAL_close (some FSAL, like POSIX, 
00382               * may not flush data until the file is closed */
00383 
00384              /*post_write_attr.asked_attributes =  pclient->attrmask ; */
00385              post_write_attr.asked_attributes =  FSAL_ATTR_SIZE | FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED ;
00386              fsal_status_getattr = FSAL_getattrs(  &(pentry->object.file.handle), pcontext, &post_write_attr ) ;
00387 
00388              /* if failed, the next block will handle the error */
00389              if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status_getattr ) ) 
00390                fsal_status = fsal_status_getattr ;
00391             else
00392                {
00393                  /* Update Cache Inode attributes */
00394                  pentry->object.file.attributes.filesize = post_write_attr.filesize ;
00395                  pentry->object.file.attributes.spaceused = post_write_attr.spaceused ;
00396                }
00397           }
00398                                      
00399 #ifndef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
00400        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00401                           "inode/direct: io_size=%llu, pio_size=%llu, eof=%d, seek=%d.%llu", 
00402                           io_size, *pio_size, *p_fsal_eof, seek_descriptor->whence, seek_descriptor->offset ) ;
00403 #endif
00404         
00405        if( cache_inode_close( pentry, pclient, pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )  
00406          {
00407            V( pentry->lock ) ;
00408            
00409            /* stats */
00410            pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00411            
00412            return *pstatus ;
00413          } 
00414      }
00415    
00416    /* IO was successfull (through cache content or not), we manually update the times in the attributes */
00417 
00418    switch( read_or_write ) 
00419     {
00420      case CACHE_INODE_READ:
00421        /* Set the atime */
00422        pentry->object.file.attributes.atime.seconds  = time( NULL ) ;
00423        pentry->object.file.attributes.atime.nseconds = 0 ;
00424        break ;
00425        
00426      case CACHE_INODE_WRITE:
00427        /* Set mtime and ctime */
00428        pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime.seconds  = time( NULL ) ;
00429        pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime.nseconds = 0 ;
00430        
00431        /* BUGAZOMEU : write operation must NOT modify file's ctime */
00432        pentry->object.file.attributes.ctime = pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime;
00433        
00434        break ;
00435      }
00436   
00437    /* Return attributes to caller */ 
00438    if( pfsal_attr != NULL ) 
00439         *pfsal_attr = pentry->object.file.attributes ;
00440 
00441    V( pentry->lock ) ; 
00442    *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00443 
00444    /* stat */
00445    if( read_or_write == CACHE_INODE_READ )
00446      {
00447        *pstatus =  cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_GET, pclient ) ;
00448 
00449        if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00450          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_READ] += 1 ;
00451        else
00452          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_READ] += 1 ;
00453      }
00454    else
00455      {
00456        *pstatus =  cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;
00457        
00458        if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00459          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_WRITE] += 1 ;
00460        else
00461          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_WRITE] += 1 ;
00462      }
00463    return *pstatus ;
00464 } /* cache_inode_rdwr */
